intro: Microlicia depauperata, commonly known as the poor man's licorice, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are followed by follicles containing numerous seeds. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
